intro: Ceodes, commonly known as the ghost tree, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is native to Australia and is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils. Ceodes species are typically shrubs or small trees, and they play a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion. Due to their unique appearance and ecological significance, they are of interest to botanists and conservationists.
